cert-manager.description: defined by either the name or alias of your dependency in Chart.yaml @ignored

clusterResourceNamespace.description: cluster-resource-namespace=my-namespace https://cert-manager.io/docs/configuration/#cluster-resource-namespace The Cluster Resource Namespace is defaulted as being the `cert-manager` namespace, A ClusterIssuer CA will create the certificate in this namespace https://cert-manager.io/docs/configuration/ca/#deployment
clusterResourceNamespace.title: clusterResourceNamespace

enabled.description: We don't create it ourselves because it's pretty hard.
enabled.title: enabled

cert-manager.title: cert-manager

enabled.description: If true, cert-manager is or will be installed on the cluster When disabled, the default ingress certificate specified on Traefik is used Not a string, a boolean so no quote
enabled.title: enabled

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

kubee.description: The kubee issuer is used to create certificates for the internal service and pods (ie the local private domain cluster.local)

bundle_name.description: const: 'kubee-ca-bundle' @schema The kubee cert bundle with the root CA and the kubee ca cert It's distributed to clients to create secure TLS connection
bundle_name.title: bundle_name

kubee.title: kubee

public.description: The public issuer name. The public issuer is used to create certificate for public access (ie public network / public domain name) Its name should be changed to `letsencrypt-prod` when the `letsencrypt-staging` is working and validated

name.description: enum: [ 'letsencrypt-staging', 'letsencrypt-prod' ] required: true @schema The public issuer name.
name.title: name

public.title: public

kubee_internal.description: Don't touch, used to block template output of cross dependency
kubee_internal.title: kubee_internal

enabled.description: We do it ourselves so that there is some logic
enabled.title: enabled

enabled.description: no matches for kind "Bundle" in version "trust.cert-manager.io/v1alpha1"
enabled.title: enabled

secretTargets.description: Traefik require the TLS data to be secret

authorizedSecrets.description: not be good executing from another context when creating our values file
authorizedSecrets.title: authorizedSecrets

secretTargets.title: secretTargets

admin_user.description: The admin user  * created as admin user in Kubernetes and other app  * added in basicAuth

cluster_role.description: required: true enum: [ 'cluster-admin', 'admin' ] @schema Kubernetes clusterRole * `cluster-admin` has full access * `admin` does not have access to node and cluster scope related object such as ClusterRoleBinding
cluster_role.title: cluster_role

email.description: format: email minLength: 1 @schema The admin email It's used by default in apps. For instance: * letsencrypt registration email * alert notifications: prometheus, argocd
email.title: email

password.description: required: true minLength: 1 @schema The admin password
password.title: password

admin_user.title: admin_user

trusted_proxies.description: Trusted Proxies If trusted, reverse proxies handler will proxy and augment the sensitive X-Forwarded-* request headers.  You should set the CIDR value of: * internal proxy such as traefik * and external proxy such as cloudflare It's used by Traefik and all auth application that needs the real ip and trust the X-forward headers
trusted_proxies.title: trusted_proxies

chart.description: The cluster chart. The cluster chart is responsible for the installation/management of Kubernetes on the nodes
chart.title: chart

distribution.description: The kubernetes distribution k3s is the distribution that has a cluster chart implemented.
distribution.title: distribution

dns.description: it's used by cert-manager for the DNS01 proof and by external dns

cloudflare.description: Cloudflare Enabled if the domain list is not empty

api_token.description: `ApiToken` is now the preferred method (ApiKey is deprecated)

key.description: required: true minLength: 1 @schema The key property (in the secret of k8s or any other provider)
key.title: key

kind.description: required: true enum: [ 'Secret', 'ExternalSecret' ] @schema The type of secret A secret or external secret The chart is responsible for supporting them
kind.title: kind

property.description: Used with the External Secret type
property.title: property

value.description: (Used with the k8s secret type to create a Kubernetes secret)
value.title: value

api_token.title: api_token

dns_zones.description: format: hostname required: true minLength: 0 @schema The dns Zones that are managed by cloudflare, Cloudflare is enabled if the list is not empty
dns_zones.title: dns_zones

cloudflare.title: cloudflare

dns.title: dns

from.description: format: email required: false @schema the default from
from.title: from

hello.description: hello (used to present itself, normally the email apex domain name)
hello.title: hello

host.description: title: Smtp host description: The smtp hostname required: true format: hostname @schema The smtp host if the host is not empty, smtp configuration are added for example for argocd email notifications
host.title: Smtp host

port.description: title: Smtp Port description: The Smtp port type: integer required: false @schema the smtp port
port.title: Smtp Port

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

name.description: The cluster name used: * to identify the cluster (for instance, on prometheus remote-write metrics, the name is added as label) * as default first instance name for operator (for instance, prometheus operator allows to install multiple prometheus that needs to be unique. Kube-prometheus asks for a unique name)
name.title: name

enabled.description: Boolean to indicate that this chart is or will be installed in the cluster
enabled.title: Enabled

external_secrets.description: A Helm sub chart for External Secrets

enabled.description: Not a string, a boolean so no quote
enabled.title: enabled

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

store.description: We support only vault for now If the api token is not empty and vault is enabled, a vault secret store is created
store.title: store

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

grafana.description: A sub-chart of the Grafana Operator

api_token.description: The auth credential (used for an external instance)
api_token.title: api_token

enabled.description: Not a string, a boolean so no quote
enabled.title: enabled

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

hostname.description: A non-empty Hostname for a cluster instance will create an ingress The hostname may be used in Prometheus alert to reference dashboard For a Grafana cloud instance, you need to enter: <Grafana-cloud-stack-name>.grafana.net
hostname.title: hostname

kubee_internal.description: used in dependency condition in chart.yaml Don't touch
kubee_internal.title: kubee_internal

name.description: It's used : * as selector to apply CRD objects such as Dashboard, .... to this instance. https://grafana.github.io/grafana-operator/docs/overview/#instanceselector * as the instance name
name.title: name

type.description: * internal: installation of grafana in the cluster * external: grafana api (for instance: grafana cloud instance, if external, the apiToken is mandatory) An empty type does not install any instance
type.title: type

grafana.title: kubee-grafana

install_cross_dependency.description: const: false @schema Constant used to not output template from kubee cross dependency in Chart.yaml Don't change, don't touch
install_cross_dependency.title: install_cross_dependency

name.description: const: kubee @schema @ignored Instance name The operator uses it to create unique alertmanager It's also a Kube-Prometheus mandatory variable
name.title: name

namespace.description: The installation namespace (create an ingress if not empty)
namespace.title: Namespace

api_key.description: Opsgenie Api Key to send alert. If the api key is not empty, critical and warning alerts are sent to opsgenie
api_key.title: api_key

service_key.description: The service key is known as integration key in pagerduty documentation
service_key.title: service_key

url.description: The url is known as integration url in pager duty documentation
url.title: url

exporter_auth.description: This is a global authentication configuration for all exporters

kube_rbac_proxy.description: # https://github.com/brancz/kube-rbac-proxy Kube Prometheus uses rbac-proxy to add an authorization layer on exporter We disable it by default: - to minimize memory (20M by exporters) and the head-heck of authorization problem. - because there is also network policy If enabled, the exporter (node and state metrics) will get an extra containers that handle RBAC authorization
kube_rbac_proxy.title: kube_rbac_proxy

network_policy.description: They allow only ingress communication from a prometheus server
network_policy.title: network_policy

exporter_auth.title: exporter_auth

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

grafana_cloud.description: grafana cloud remote write prometheus integration

relabel_keep_regex.description: Example: `phpfpm_*` would send only the metrics starting with phpfpm `(phpfpm|argocd|node|traefik)_(.*)` would send the metrics starting with phpfpm, argocd, node and traefik Doc: https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/configuration/configuration/#relabel_config By default, no filtering is applied
relabel_keep_regex.title: relabel_keep_regex

grafana_cloud.title: grafana_cloud

hostname.description: If not null, an ingress is added
hostname.title: hostname

kubee_internal.description: in the prometheus release It's used in the chart dependencies condition

install_cross_dependency.description: Don't modify the value, don't change
install_cross_dependency.title: install_cross_dependency

kubee_internal.title: kubee_internal

max_block_duration.description: storage.tsdb.max-block-duration=2h) Note that the default value is * 1h for the prometheus query ui * 1h for the grafana explore panel (ie last hour) * 15m for Kubernetes dashboard * 24h for Headlamp We chose 30m to be below the target of 400Mi memory size with kubernetes monitoring installed
max_block_duration.title: max_block_duration

name.description: (used by clients such as the grafana Chart to create a connection)
name.title: name

namespace.description: used by clients such as the Grafana Chart to create the data source URI
namespace.title: namespace

new_relic.description: new relic remote write prometheus integration

relabel_keep_regex.description: Example: `phpfpm_*` would send only the metrics starting with phpfpm `(phpfpm|argocd|node|traefik)_(.*)` would send the metrics starting with phpfpm, argocd, node and traefik Doc: https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/configuration/configuration/#relabel_config By default, no filtering is applied
relabel_keep_regex.title: relabel_keep_regex

new_relic.title: new_relic

memory.description: Memory of the prometheus operator instance (value based on experience)
memory.title: memory

memory.description: Dynamically, if you query data above the max_block_duration, data is loaded in memory Why? 400Mi. This is: * the default of Kube-Prometheus with default memory setting. * the amount that we get after installing kubernetes-monitoring This is our goal
memory.title: memory

retention.description: storage.tsdb.retention.time=24h) Data in memory is 2 hour old, by setting retention to 2h, we don't allow to query data over 2 hours and to load data in memory The default is 24h Why 30m? Equal to max_block_duration so that we are sure that we will not increase memory of the prometheus pod
retention.title: retention

scrape_interval.description: It does influence memory as Prometheus keeps by default 2 hours of scraping in memory (max_block_duration) Default was 30s
scrape_interval.title: scrape_interval

kind.description: Values supported `Secret` or `ExternalSecret` With `ExternalSecret`, you can use a gitops pull solutions such as ArgoCd/Flux.
kind.title: kind

kind.description: The kind of Secret manifest created
kind.title: kind

middleware_name.description: That's applied for internal web app (such as Traefik Dashboard, Prometheus, Alert Manager, ...) The app or api endpoints are still available from an internal container The supported auth are basic-auth and forward-auth Before changing to forward-auth, you should test it with the whoami chart
middleware_name.title: middleware_name

private_networks.description: used for Ingress Ip restrictions (Traefik IpAllowList) example for a home ip: 143.176.206.80/32
private_networks.title: private_networks

default_certificate.description: Set the default certificate as default traefik cert Mandatory for kubernetes-dashboard on a local development The rootCA should be added to the OS/Browser as trusted root CA https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/https/tls/#default-certificate
default_certificate.title: default_certificate

entrypoints.description: Used by template that creates IngressRoute (http and tcp)
entrypoints.title: entrypoints

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

hostname.description: The FQDN is dnsName.apexDomain If not empty, an ingress is created example: hostname: 'traefik-haship.nip.io'
hostname.title: hostname

auth_headers.description: Middleware to apply auth headers on website with an authentication form
auth_headers.title: auth_headers

basic_auth.description: With the email as main identifier https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/middlewares/http/basicauth/ The admin user is added

users.description: List of extra users alongside the admin user
users.title: users

basic_auth.title: basic_auth

forward_auth_bearer.description: It can be applied on Kube API client such as Kubernetes Dashboard'
forward_auth_bearer.title: forward_auth_bearer

git_hooks.description: Used in Gitops app such as Argocd https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/middlewares/http/ipallowlist/

private_network.description: Ip are given via the auth.private_networks
private_network.title: private_network

namespace.description: The kube-system namespace tells kubernetes that this app has a higher priority
namespace.title: namespace

service.description: This value creates a dedicated metrics service to use with ServiceMonitor Enable Prometheus Metrics https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/observability/metrics/prometheus/ Metrics Info: https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/observability/metrics/overview/#global-metrics
service.title: service

nodeSelector.description: nodeSelector is the simplest recommended form of node selection constraint.
nodeSelector.title: nodeSelector

expose.description: Defines whether the port is listed in the service if service.type is LoadBalancer or NodePort.
expose.title: expose

expose.description: Defines whether the port is listed in the service if service.type is LoadBalancer or NodePort.
expose.title: expose

allowEmptyServices.description: return 503, needed to start stopped container with sablier
allowEmptyServices.title: allowEmptyServices

ipFamilyPolicy.description: You can't set up a nodePort because the port is a high-end port between 30000-32767 You can install it as DaemonSet + Node port ? https://github.com/traefik/traefik-helm-chart/blob/master/EXAMPLES.md#install-as-a-daemonset
ipFamilyPolicy.title: ipFamilyPolicy

externalTrafficPolicy.description: Allow Origin Remote IP to be forwarded
externalTrafficPolicy.title: externalTrafficPolicy

watchdog.description: `Watchdog`: the receiver of the [watchdog alert](https://runbooks.prometheus-operator.dev/runbooks/general/watchdog) Example of cron monitoring system: https://healthchecks.io/

email.description: Email address (to check if we can send email)

repeat_interval.description: The interval of notification (By default, one email every 12 hours)
repeat_interval.title: repeat_interval

webhook.description: WebHook Url (to check if prometheus is still up)

repeat_interval.description: The interval of notification (By default, one http request every 10 min)
